headline: They Spent 4 Months Tracking Every Dollar And Somehow They're Still Broke. 'Thought I'd Find The Problem'
summary: Earning a decent salary doesn’t always guarantee financial stability. One Reddit user brought that reality into focus when they revealed that, despite making $68,000 a year, they were still living paycheck to paycheck. Tracking Everything But Still Bleeding Cash “I make $68k. Live alone. No kids. No debt besides my car payment,” the original poster wrote on r/SavingMoney recently. “Should have money left over every month but my checking account is always sitting at like $400 by the time I get pa

headline: UPS Resets Priorities With Cost Cuts And Healthcare Logistics Push
summary: UPS (NYSE:UPS) has announced a major overhaul of its operations, including up to 30,000 job cuts and the closure of two dozen facilities. The company plans to reduce its Amazon delivery volume as it shifts focus toward higher margin business. UPS is expanding in healthcare logistics through acquisitions of Frigo-Trans and Andlauer Healthcare Group to grow its global cold chain capabilities. United Parcel Service, trading at $105.99, is undertaking a large restructuring while its longer term...

headline: Robinhood CEO Vlad Tenev Downplays AI Job Fears, Saying 'AI Will Lead To An Explosion Of New Jobs' While Warning Change 'Makes Us Very Nervous'
summary: Artificial intelligence is accelerating changes to how work gets done, raising questions about whether technology replaces jobs or reshapes them. AI is more likely to change how work is structured than eliminate jobs altogether, Robinhood Markets Inc. (NASDAQ:HOOD) CEO Vlad Tenev recently told Fox Business. He said past technological shifts show that new tools have repeatedly reshaped labor rather than removed it, even as uncertainty often accompanies periods of transition. Don't Miss: The AI Ma

headline: The Week in Numbers: Samsung rides the AI boom, Amazon chops jobs
summary:
STORY: From Samsung's record profits to Amazon's huge job cuts...

This is the Week in Numbers.

:: The Week in Numbers

:: $11.4 billion

$11.4 billion was the operating profit of Samsung's chip business in the fourth quarter.

The AI boom drove the company's main cash cow up 490% from a year earlier to a record high.

But the South Korean company forecast a chip shortage will get worse this year.

That as the race to build AI hits supply and boosts prices.

:: 8%

8% was the plunge in LVMH shares during a midweek sell-off.

Investors shed the stock after fourth-quarter results lowered hopes of a recovery in luxury demand.

The sector continued to be weighed down by slow sales in the important Chinese market.

While LVMH CEO Bernard Arnault also gave a cautious outlook.

:: $30 billion

$30 billion is the amount Japan's Softbank is reported to be considering investing in OpenAI.

That's what a source told Reuters.

The money would be part of a funding round that could raise up to $100 billion, valuing the company at about $830 billion.

Softbank previously said it had completed a $41 billion investment, giving it an 11% stake in the ChatGPT maker.

:: 16,000 

16,000 is the number of jobs Amazon said it would cut worldwide.

It marks the second round of major layoffs at the company in three months.

The tech giant is restructuring after pandemic-era over-hiring, and it's expanding its adoption of AI tools.

It comes months after Amazon cut 14,000 white-collar jobs in late October.

:: $50 billion 

$50 billion is the amount Elon Musk's SpaceX aims to raise in an initial public offering (IPO).

That's from a report in the Financial Times, which Reuters couldn't verify.

It would value the rocket and satellite company at around $1.5 trillion.

And make the listing the largest in history in terms of deal size.

content.title: The Week in Numbers: Samsung rides the AI boom, Amazon chops jobs

:: 8%

8% was the plunge in LVMH shares during a midweek sell-off.

Investors shed the stock after fourth-quarter results lowered hopes of a recovery in luxury demand.

The sector continued to be weighed down by slow sales in the important Chinese market.

16,000 is the number of jobs Amazon said it would cut worldwide.

It marks the second round of major layoffs at the company in three months.

The tech giant is restructuring after pandemic-era over-hiring, and it's expanding its adoption of AI tools.

It comes months after Amazon cut 14,000 white-collar jobs in late October.

$50 billion is the amount Elon Musk's SpaceX aims to raise in an initial public offering (IPO).

That's from a report in the Financial Times, which Reuters couldn't verify.

It would value the rocket and satellite company at around $1.5 trillion.
